Study demonstrates that redundant complexes formed by the mutant SYK(Y3F) protein allow it to maintain signaling to receptor-proximal interaction partners, resulting in proper initiation of BCR-proximal signals.

The study identified the criteria for the design of binders that specifically address either the Syk or the Zap-70 Tandem Src Homology 2 Domains, tSH2. While Syk tSH2 has a rather broad substrate scope, ZAP-70 tSH2 required a proximal arrangement of the phosphotyrosine ligands in defined strand orientation.
Syk-induced signals in bone marrow stromal cell lines are mediated by phospholipase C gamma1 (PLCgamma1) in osteogenesis and PLCgamma2 in adipogenesis.
The LMP2A of Epstein-Barr Virus was found to interfer with cofilin degradation in nasopharyngeal cancer cells by accelerating the proteasomal degradation of Cbl and Syk.

Results show that Syk activation occurs following Abeta deposition and the formation of tau pathological species. As Syk activation also promotes Abeta formation and tau hyperphosphorylation, results suggest that Alzheimer's disease pathological lesions may be self-propagating via a Syk dependent mechanism highlighting Syk as an attractive therapeutic target for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease.

Comparison of the distributions of tau pTyr18 and double-phosphorylated Syk in the transgenic mouse brain and human hippocampus showed that the phosphorylation of tyrosine 18 in tau already occurs at an early stage of tauopathy and increases with the progression of neurodegeneration. Syk appears unlikely to be a major kinase that phosphorylates tyrosine 18 of tau at the early stage of tauopathy.
Expression of SYK and its splice variants was significantly lower in tumors with MSI, and in KRAS wild type, BRAF mutant and PTEN mutant tumors

Aberrant SYK overexpression in monomorphic epitheliotropic intestinal T-cell lymphoma is likely caused by hypomethylation of the SYK promoter, while no common mutations in the SYK gene or in its promoter could be detected.
In this article, the authors have shown that Natural killer cells can reduce their functional role through downregulation of Syk and Zap70 kinases.
High SYK expression is associated with Intestinal Inflammation and Immune Dysfunction in Inflammatory Bowel Diseases.
Calcium phosphate particles stimulate SYK and caspase-1 activation in vascular smooth muscle cells, leading to the release of IL-1beta, at least in part via exosomes.
High SYK expression is associated with glioma.
integrin cytoplasmic domains do not directly induce Syk conformational changes and do not activate Syk via the same mechanism as double-phosphorylated immunoreceptor tyrosine-based activation motif.

Study of skin biopsy samples from bullous pemphigoid patients and immunization-induced murine experimental epidermolysis bullosa identified SYK expression in dermal myeloid cells as a requirement to promote inflammation in autoantibody-driven pathologies.

Abdominal aortic aneurysm tissue showed deposition of IgG and activation of Syk, a key molecule in B-cell activation and immunoglobulin function, which were localized to infiltrating cells including B cells and macrophages.
A new mechanism by which SYK signaling regulates ovarian cancer cell motility.
NF-kappaB and Syk signaling pathways are instrumental for cancer progression. (Review)
DFNA5 variant is associated with tobacco- and HPV-mediated oral oncogenesis.

hese results implicate that Syk controls oxidative stress-induced human B cell death via nuclear translocation of Nrf2 and MMP collapse. These results suggest that Syk is a novel regulator of Nrf2 activation.
Low SYK(L) expression is associated with epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition in lung cancer.

Cerdulatinib potently and selectively inhibited SYK/JAK signaling at tolerated exposures in patients with relapsed/refractory B-cell malignancies. The extent of target inhibition in whole-blood assays and suppression of inflammation correlated with tumor response.
Increased expression of SYK is associated with colon adenocarcinoma.
LMP2A-mutant cell lines and pharmacologic inhibitors indicate that LMP2A activates a Syk/PI3K/NF-kappaB pathway to enhance MIP-1alpha.

After blocking the beta-glucan receptor (CR3) or inhibiting downstream kinase (SYK) in neutrophils, the killing percent to C. albicans (regardless of endemic and non-endemic strains) and the ratio of LC3B-II/I of neutrophils were significantly decreased.
Results suggest that Syk, MAP4, and calpain-1 expression are correlated with each other and these proteins may be involved in early stages of tumour spread.
Re-expression of SHP1 in GCB DBLCL cells reduces SYK, BLNK, and GSK3 phosphorylation.

results are consistent with the alternative model, indicating that ppITAM binding primes SYK for rapid LYN-mediated phosphorylation of Tyr-352 and then Tyr-348 of the SH2-kinase linker, which facilitates activation loop phosphorylation and full SYK activation.
Here, the authors report that Mycobacterium bovis BCG promotes IL-10 expression and cytokine production by establishing a SYK/PKCalpha/beta positive feedback loop that leads to STAT3 activation.
Circ_RUSC2 upregulates the expression of miR-661 target gene SYK and regulates the function of vascular smooth muscle cells
Findings provide evidence of suppression of tumorigenicity 5 (ST5) involvement in positive regulation of osteoclastogenesis via src Kinases (Src)/Syk Kinase (Syk)/calcium signaling.
The combination of FLT3 and SYK kinase inhibitors is toxic to leukaemia cells with CBL mutations.
Signaling Response to Transient Redox Stress in Human Isolated T Cells: Molecular Sensor Role of Syk Kinase and Functional Involvement of IL2 Receptor and L-Selectine.
A SYK/SHC1 pathway regulates the amount of CFTR in the plasma membrane.
SYK is activated by mutated MYD88 and drives pro-survival signaling in MYD88 driven B-cell lymphomas.
Cytokine Production and NET Formation by Monosodium Urate-Activated Human Neutrophils Involves Early and Late Events, and Requires Upstream TAK1 and Syk.
TOSO interacts with SYK and enhances BCR pathway activation in chronic lymphocytic leukemia.
Syk Inhibitors: New Computational Insights into Their Intraerythrocytic Action in Plasmodium falciparum Malaria.
The FcgammaRIIa-Syk Axis Controls Human Dendritic Cell Activation and T Cell Response Induced by Infliximab Aggregates.
The Serine/Threonine Protein Phosphatase 2A (PP2A) Regulates Syk Activity in Human Platelets.
Syk facilitates phagosome-lysosome fusion by regulating actin-remodeling in complement-mediated phagocytosis.
IRF4 modulates the response to BCR activation in chronic lymphocytic leukemia regulating IKAROS and SYK.
Spleen tyrosine kinase regulates crosstalk of hypoxia-inducible factor-1alpha and nuclear factor (erythroid-derived2)-like 2 for B cell survival.
Gain-of-function variants in SYK cause immune dysregulation and systemic inflammation in humans and mice.
Complement receptor 3 mediates both sinking phagocytosis and phagocytic cup formation via distinct mechanisms.
Developmental partitioning of SYK and ZAP70 prevents autoimmunity and cancer.
Comprehensive analysis of Syk gene methylation in colorectal cancer.
Regulatory interplay between Vav1, Syk and beta-catenin occurs in lung cancer cells.
miR-96-5p is the tumor suppressor in osteosarcoma via targeting SYK.

SYK-3BP2 Pathway Activity in Parenchymal and Myeloid Cells Is a Key Pathogenic Factor in Metabolic Steatohepatitis.
Differences in the dynamics of the tandem-SH2 modules of the Syk and ZAP-70 tyrosine kinases.
STING-Mediated Interferon Induction by Herpes Simplex Virus 1 Requires the Protein Tyrosine Kinase Syk.
Role of Tyrosine Kinase Syk in Thrombus Stabilisation at High Shear.
A new role for the SRC family kinase HCK as a driver of SYK activation in MYD88 mutated lymphomas.

Inhibition of Src but not Syk causes weak reversal of GPVI-mediated platelet aggregation measured by light transmission aggregometry.

Spleen tyrosine kinase inhibition restores myeloid homeostasis in COVID-19.

Mast cells are upregulated in hidradenitis suppurativa tissue, associated with epithelialized tunnels and normalized by spleen tyrosine kinase antagonism.
Spleen tyrosine kinase facilitates the progression of papillary thyroid cancer regulated by the hsa_circ_0006417/miR-377-3p axis.
DNA hypomethylation of Syk induces oxidative stress and apoptosis via the PKCbeta/P66shc signaling pathway in diabetic kidney disease.

Syk-dependent homologous recombination activation promotes cancer resistance to DNA targeted therapy.

summary: This gene encodes a member of the family of non-receptor type Tyr protein kinases. This protein is widely expressed in hematopoietic cells and is involved in coupling activated immunoreceptors to downstream signaling events that mediate diverse cellular responses, including proliferation, differentiation, and phagocytosis. It is thought to be a modulator of epithelial cell growth and a potential tumour suppressor in human breast carcinomas. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2010].
